intro: Chaenorhinum macropodum subsp. degenii, commonly known as the narrow-leaf common toadflax, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. It is often found in coastal areas and is considered a hardy, drought-tolerant species.
